result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the State of WI, or any other state, or of the USA. Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case. Pay a fine of $250 plus costs as to Count 3. Comply with all conditions of probation in this file as to Count 3. Violation of any rule of probation, or revocation from probation, constitutes a violation of this condition. Defendant will keep the Douglas County Clerk of Courts Office informed of his address and telephone number at all times.

Undergo an Alcohol and Other Drugs of Abuse (AODA) evaluation no later than January 13, 2023 and sign a release of information to allow the service provider to communicate with the DA's Office. Provide a copy of the evaluation to the DA's Office within 30 days of the completion of the evaluation. Follow all recommendations as recommended in the evaluation.

timeConds.notes: The defendant will perform 40 hours of community service at a nonprofit organization located within Douglas County or within Douglas County which is mutually agreeable to the parties.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentences, if revoked

miscConds.notes: Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Upon successful completion of probation, defendant would be eligible for expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Ross Shaw

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Ross Shaw
Current: 27 Korda Drive, Duluth, MN 55808 United States  (Effective: 10-11-2022)
Prior: 2067 Hwy 210, Carlton, MN 55718

AND ARRAIGNMENT 9:36 AM Defendant Brandon Ross Shaw in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Brandon Ross Shaw.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend and add count 3, possession as a misdemeanor. Defendant will plead to count 1 and amended count 3. Count 1 will be subject to terms of the deferred agreement for 36 months. Count 2 will be dismissed. Defendant will pleas to count 3, sentence of 90 days jail imposed and stayed for a period of 1 year of probation. Conditions of 2 days jail with credit for 2 days (time served), DOC programming, $250 fine plus costs. Parties stipulate that the defendant would be eligible for expunction upon successful completion of probation.  
Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 3. Attorney Gramstrup stipulates to a factual basis. Court finds that the pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Court accepts the defendant's pleas and the defendant is found guilty. Count 2 is dismissed. Judgment of conviction is deferred on count 1 pursuant to the terms of the agreement for 36 months (Oct 10, 2025). Defendant is reminded to keep address updated. 
Court orders on count 3, sentence of 90 days jail consecutive to any other sentences imposed and stayed for a period of 1 year of probation. Conditions of 2 days jail with credit for 2 days (time served), DOC programming, $250 fine plus costs. Upon successful completion of probation, defendant may have expungement.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM Defendant Brandon Ross Shaw in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Brandon Ross Shaw.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Gramstrup- Client will waive prelim
Court finds probable cause for bind over. Sets for arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon Ross Shaw appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Brandon Ross Shaw. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $1000 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant has no prior criminal history and lives in Carlton County, MN. Attorney Reid indicates that defendant does not have criminal history and is life long resident of St. Louis County with family in the area. Asks court to consider $200 cash or signature bond, defendant could post up to $500. 

Court orders $2500 signature bond. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
